attributes.action: MPs should be legally obliged to publish their annual tax returns.
attributes.background: We need more transparency in public office. MPs are elected by the public and paid by the public purse. Being an MP should be a full-time job and payment for work outside office should be declared and open to scrutiny. Only by seeing this can the public decide if there is conflict of interests.

attributes.action: Make handfasting a legal ceremony
attributes.background: The tradition of handfasting has been practiced for thousands of years pre-dating any wedding ceremony concocted by any modern religion/faith. These have their marriages recognised by law and there is no good reason why this same right should not be extended to include Pagan faiths.
attributes.additional_details:
The Marriage (Scotland) Act 1977 made Pagan weddings and handfastings legal in Scotland, allowing Norse, Druids & other Pagans to obtain legally recognised marriage ceremonies in accordance with their faith, but at present Pagans in England & Wales do not have that right.
We request that the government recognise how important it is for people to be able to be joined in matrimony in accordance with their religious beliefs and give Pagan handfasting legal recognition in England and Wales without prejudice and without having to have a second ceremony to legalise the commitment.

attributes.action: Improve funding for mental health treatment for young people in Cornwall
attributes.background: Cornwall is one of the only counties in the UK to have no dedicated mental health treatment centre for people under 18. With the government's promise of £1.4bn of extra funding for mental health, we believe there is an opportunity to tackle this silent crisis. #ThinkPositive and sign the petition.

attributes.action: Establish an independent department to ensure truthful politics
attributes.background: In a year where the Oxford English Dictionary names its Word of the Year as 'post-truth', then something has gone wrong in the politics & campaigning world. This is a petition asking for the establishing of an independent department that will ensure truthful politics.
attributes.additional_details: We had the infamous claim that if we leave the EU, instead of sending £350 million a week to them, we can send it to the NHS; and then after the result declaring that we didn't actually send the EU that much money, & also it wouldn't be going directly to the NHS. This new independent department should consist of teams from Ofcom,Advertising Agency,CPS,ONS and electoral lawyers (etc) to ensure that no politician can mislead the public with unsubstantiated claims and that UK politics are truthful.

attributes.action: Make the taking of fish from all privately owned waters a criminal offence
attributes.background: Fishing is the most participated sport in the UK, however, the illegal removal of fish from privately owned lakes is having a devastating impact on the future of all angling, the cost of replacing stolen fish is crippling local clubs and associations lakes and must be stopped

attributes.action: End all government subsides and other financial aid to the fossil fuel industry.
attributes.background: The UK government provides the domestic fossil fuel industry with funds to the tune of £6 billion annually. This industry, endangering all of us by intensifying climate change, is getting money from our government at the expense of the taxpayer. This has to stop before it is too late.
attributes.additional_details:
Direct subsides are hard to calculate –  Reasonable mid-range figure is £6 billion annually, given by widely trusted sources such as the Independent and the Overseas Development Institute(ODI) however the UK claims not to have any using an irrational definition. The International Monetary Fund puts the figure much higher at £26b.
This petition's specific demand is that fossil fuel subsides, as defined by the ODI are to be abolished by 2020 and the extra revenue should be invested in clean energy.

attributes.action: Refund child maintenance if DNA testing proves a man isn't the biological Father
attributes.background:
My husband recently discovered that the child he has been raising for almost six years is not biologically his, following DNA testing.

As the Mother had always maintained that he was the father, he has been paying maintenance through the CSA for five years. 

He has no legal right to a refund.
attributes.additional_details:
The only way to attempt to get the money back is by claiming fraud in court which is costly, time consuming and not guaranteed. 

This is totally unfair and I believe the Mother should have a legal obligation to pay this money back via an attachment of earnings or a deduction of benefits, in the same way that Father's are forced to pay maintenance by the government.

Please sign this petition to have the issue debated in parliment, and bring about change in a system which unfairly favours women.

attributes.action: Create awareness of Peritoneal Mesothelioma and support clinical trials for cure
attributes.background: The government must raise awareness of peritoneal mesothelioma so health professionals and the public are aware of the signs and symptoms of this rare, but increasing, disease, leading to earlier diagnosis and better prognosis for patients.they must also support clinical trials to help find a cure.
attributes.additional_details: My mum was diagnosed with peritoneal mesothelioma 2 yrs ago after 6 yrs of symptoms and numerous misdiagnoses. she was given 2 Weeks to live a yr ago but still fights on.Mums diagnosis came too late for her to have life lengthening surgery,and at every turn we are told there is nothing that can be done. Many Drs haven't even heard of the illness.No trials are ongoing for a cure because "drugs companies won't make enough money due to the relatively small number of people with the disease"

attributes.action: Make final UK Brexit deal subject to binding, minimum 10% majority, referendum.
attributes.background: Current Brexit discussions are largely uninformed and confused. There's no reason to think that they will not remain post Article 50 triggering. Lies, half-truths were expounded, later admitted false. EU is UK's biggest market, we need to maintain our relationship and work to reform it from inside.
attributes.additional_details: The EU non-binding referendum in June 2016 gave options to stay in / out. 29m citizens did not vote Leave. The 4% majority: Leave vs Remain actual voters is an iniquitous outcome for the majority of citizens. Many failed to understand Leave implications fully. The issue is highly political and self serving for some individuals. Our EU membership is an economic - trade issue. Key are the Single Market and Customs Union, NOT immigration. Other options exist, but unquantified, thus risky.

attributes.action: Exempt homes that people are living in from the definition of "brownfield" land.
attributes.background: The current definition of brownfield land puts your home at risk. Brownfield land used to be thought of as ex-industrial but your home is now considered to be 'brownfield' (land which has been previously developed). The National Planning Policy Framework prioritises brownfield land for development.
attributes.additional_details: As profits to be made out of regeneration increase, this risk extends to more and more occupied homes. Homes are compulsorily purchased and existing tenants evicted so the land can be sold for development. At the moment this is mainly the terrified residents of council estates - because councils own some of the land already, can force out their own tenants & CPO leaseholders & freeholders relatively cheaply. But the brownfield definition means it will be any homes where a profit can be made.

attributes.action: Make "sex and relationship" education compulsory in all schools.
attributes.background: All teenagers need to learn about appropriate, consensual relationships and sex. Some young people are lucky enough to have appropriate and necessary talks with parents/carers but this is not always the case so needs to be the responsibility of schools.
attributes.additional_details: This is especially crucial for young LGBT+ people because it is unlikely that many parents/carers will cover LGBT+ issues with their children. Look at the "legacy" that Section 28 has left, including a high proportion mental health issues among LGBT+. Faith schools are not exempt from this because they do not agree with homosexuality, if anything it is even more crucial that LGBT students here are set up for a healthy adult life.

attributes.action: Commercial images of photoshopped bodies should be marked 'retouched photo'.
attributes.background: Conditions such as anorexia and muscle dysmorphic disorder are more common than ever. We are bombarded by photoshopped bodies in advertising campaigns and magazines, creating unrealistic expectations of what a healthy body looks like. I wish for government legislation to be passed to combat this.
attributes.additional_details: This year, France bring into law legislation, stating that any image that has been digitally altered to change a model's body shape must be marked 'retouched photograph': Any companies found to be breaching these rules will be fined  37,500 Euros. I propose that the British government follow suit and pass legislation in order to make it unlawful for fashion magazines and advertising campaigns to fail to disclose that models' images have been digitally altered.

attributes.action: Have advertisements on tv, the dangers of anyone taking risks around HGVs
attributes.background: A worry in this country is people's unawareness of how there actions can lead to fatilities around Hgvs we need to build awareness and I think having advertisements on TVs could really make a big difference and hopefully save life's for cyclists and many more

attributes.action: End unlawful detention without trial for political opponents in Bangladesh
attributes.background: Since 2009 the Bangladesh government have been purging members of opposition parties, in particular the Bangladesh National Party (BNP).  In August 2016 Hummam Chowdhury and Mir Ahmad Bin Quasem with links to the BNP, were picked arrested and continue to be unlawfully detained without trial.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the UK government to put diplomatic pressure on the Bangladesh government and Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to immediately end the detention of political opponents of the Awami League Party and release Mr Chowdhury and Mr Bin Quasem.  The UK government should do everything it can to prevent further human rights abuses in Bangladesh and should consider pressing for sanctions with the international community if this practice persists.

attributes.action: Encourage 16 nations who ban Israeli passport holders to lift their ban.
attributes.background: In the recent events over President Donald Trump putting a temporary ban on nationals from 7 nations entering the USA it came to light that 16 nations had a permanent ban on Israeli passport holders from entering their countries. These nations need to be encouraged to lift that ban.

attributes.action: Decommission Trident missiles.
attributes.background: When the NHS is under immense strain, it is appalling to know that the single nuclear Trident warhead that missed its target zone cost the UK £17,000,000. Trident is also far more an aggressor than a defense, so I urge everyone who sees this- In the name of Peace and Prosperity, help disarm Trident!
attributes.additional_details: The single missile that failed cost £17,000,000- the same cost as the cost of employing 700 nurses for the NHS a year- it is already strained, with pregnant women having to wait up to 4 hours to be seen. This was lied about in Parliament and so it is fair to have it debated again.

attributes.action: Make 30 hours free childcare for ALL ages not just 2,3&4 year olds.
attributes.background: As a working parent, who is currently on maternity knowing how to afford nursery fees for when I go back to nursery is a worry! There is free hours but for the older children. Not my 6 month old! 15/30 hours for working families who are on the under £100,000 per year income need a helping hand!
attributes.additional_details: More and more parents, families and single mums or dads struggle with paying rent, mortgages bills and juggle every day life let alone another £156 per week bill For nursey just to be able to go back to work full time, maternity lasts 8/9 months, the 15 hours is only eligible for 2,3&4 years of age! What about the 9-24 months of age babies?

attributes.action: Prevent Donald Trump from UK Entry
attributes.background: The signatories believe Donald J Trump should be banned from UK entry. This is a resubmission of the previous petition prior to his election.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has banned entry to many individuals for hate speech. The same principles should apply to everyone who wishes to enter the UK. 

If the United Kingdom is to continue applying the 'unacceptable behaviour' criteria to those who wish to enter its borders, it must be fairly applied to the rich as well as poor, and the weak as well as powerful.

attributes.action: Stop the Boundary Commission splitting Great Grimsby into two constituencies
attributes.background: Parliamentary boundaries define the area where a person votes for their local MP – their parliamentary constituency. A boundary review examines these areas and makes proposals for a new set of boundaries which are fairer and more equal, while also trying to reflect GEOGRAPHIC FACTORS and LOCAL TIES.
attributes.additional_details: The Boundary Commission’s proposal to cut our historic town completely down the middle therefore makes no sense, separating the famed docks in East Marsh Ward from the centrepiece People’s Park in Park Ward and the River Freshney in Freshney Ward from the ancient village in Scartho Ward. The proposal is unfair, undemocratic and unacceptable and is based on an out-of-date version of the electoral register. Sign this petition and keep the town of Great Grimsby in one seat.

attributes.action: Increase free and confidential mental health support for students aged 13-25
attributes.background: Recently there have been drastic cuts to mental health services, even though many school students are affected by mental illness; this need has been further heightened by an increase of suicide in universities.

attributes.action: Ban hospitals from charging for parking in England
attributes.background:
Scotland and Wales do not charge for parking at their NHS hospitals.  Why do England charge us to park for essential visits to hospital?
People are being charged extortionate amounts to access healthcare when they have already paid taxes and National Insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
As an ex NHS nurse, I remember when hospital car parks were free.  I can also remember, that when charges came into force, I had to claim the money back from the NHS when I was visiting a patient!
My local hospital Trust has collected over £4m in car parking charges over the last year.  I am sure this money goes over and above the required amount to operate the car parks.  Scotland and Wales provide free car parking. There is a definate disparity in fairness and policy.
WHY?

attributes.action: Make it UK law to label all consumer products as vegan/vegetarian/non-vegetarian
attributes.background: There has been numerous times when I have discovered (by contacting companies) a product is vegetarian, yet it is not disclosed on the packaging. Stating items as vegan/vegetarian or not should become a legal requirement as it would make it easier to purchase according to each individual lifestyle.
attributes.additional_details: This law should apply to ALL consumer products sold in the UK from food and drink to cosmetics and everyday essentials, such as toothpaste and hand wash.

attributes.action: Make it law that all cyclists have to wear helmets.
attributes.background: After seeing the damage falling from a bicycle can cause I feel it should now be law for anyone using a cycle to have to wear a cycle helmet !  More bicycles are now capable of the same speeds as mopeds and scooters and some electric bicycles can reach speeds in excess of 20mph! lets make this law..
attributes.additional_details:
Studies show that wearing a helmet can make it 70% less likely that you suffer major head trauma should you fall off or be involved in an accident while riding a bicycle. If you think your to cool to wear one spend an hour in the NCCU and think again.
We have rules and regulations for many things less damaging lets make this law and save lives.

attributes.action: Establish legal presumption of shared, 50:50, care after parents' break up
attributes.background:
The adversarial character of family legal system is not fit for purpose.
The bias of legal professionals ( lawers, social workers, caffcass officers, family centres staff, judges) is causing more harm then good . Simple initial presumption of 50 :50 child care split will give power back to parents
attributes.additional_details:
In Sweden approximately40% of separated parents share care 50:50 and it is higher amongst younger children.
In the majority of cases the minimum of shared parenting is 30%
Just 2% of disputes are resolved in court

attributes.action: Reverse the mortgage interest tax relief restriction on ‘individual’ landlords.
attributes.background:
The government will curb the amount of tax landlords can claim back on their property investments, meaning buying and renting out property may no longer be viable for many.
This will result in some landlords who finance their business with mortgages paying tax despite making no profit.
attributes.additional_details:
The policy discriminates against individual buy-to-let investors by denying them the same rights as other business owners.'
In no other business are costs wholly incurred to fund the business liable for taxation.

attributes.action: Mandatory First Aid training and certificate to all students 15-18 years old
attributes.background: Mandatory First Aid training is excellent as no one ever knows if or when a medical situation will arise, therefore these skills will be necessary in order to save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 140,000 people every year die in situations where their lives could have been saved if somebody had known first aid according to a article from the Guardian. 
Around 2 million people are in secondary education, therefore providing mandatory first aid to would decrease the numbers of people dying due to preventative deaths significantly.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of vehicle/ van lock picks in the UK
attributes.background: In a new scandal, hundreds of vans are having their security systems bypassed by lock picks used by thieves. All doors are unlocked and the alarm turned off, so that thieves can relieve tradesmen of their hard earned tools, taking away their livelihood and taking food off tables.

attributes.action: Hold an Emergency General Election, to be held no later than February 20th 2017.
attributes.background: In order to restore public faith in the Democratic process, the public should be given the option to affirm its faith in the current government or to overturn it in a General Election.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May demanded the Same action when Gordon Brown took power in 2007.
The Fixed Term Parliament Act 2011 has provisions so that under certain circumstances a snap General Election may be held.
The Government has already Ignored numerous Petitions this year including the Largest Petition in British Political history.
The Leadership Crises that plagued almost all the Major Political Parties in Parliament should allow the British Public to have their say once again in a General Election.

attributes.action: Regulate mobile phone bundled contracts to stop hidden charges & data misselling
attributes.background: Consumer request to regulate over-charging in 24 month bundled contracts, ensuring clearer, transparent pricing for both the phone and the tariff in the contract, ensuring customers can get access to their data consumption and aren’t overcharged for data they don’t need, or overpay for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
consumers know they aren't getting the best deal http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/bills/article-3517540/The-mobile-phone-rip-Confusing-tariffs-unclear-pricing-shoddy-sales-staff-mean-overpaying-130-phone-contracts.html 
over £5bn per year being wasted by being on the wrong contracts https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2011/apr/11/mobile-phone-users-wasting-5bn customers need have greater access and more control over their service contracts with the networks http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3973532/Millions-mobile-phone-users-able-ditch-supplier-mid-contract-t-signal-plan-MPs-beat-coverage-blackspots.html

attributes.action: Get the government to licence the use of PD-1 immunotherapy to treat cancer
attributes.background: I was shocked to learn of a 36 year old woman who had to pay £50K for this to treat secondary lung cancer following treatment for Breast Cancer. It should be available in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: My Oncologist agrees it works.

attributes.action: Government introduce & underwrite affordability mortgages for first time buyers
attributes.background: It's unfair that young people have to pay such extortionate rents & may never own their own homes.  They are paying incredibly high rents with no security and this has to be re-balanced.  If they have been proven to pay rent &  have good credit history they should be able to own their own home

attributes.action: Force the legal separation of ticketing companies from ticket resale companies.
attributes.background:
Allowing ticketing companies to own related companies which can resell tickets at a higher price has an inherent conflict.
The ticketing companies have no interest in selling all tickets at original face value as they will inflate their profits by selling them through their related businesses.

attributes.action: Investigations offered for all miscarried babies regardless of gestation.
attributes.background: Miscarrying a much loved and wanted child is heart breaking.  It is a life changing event that leaves the parents, especially the mother, with many unanswered questions.  Often guilt is felt and not knowing WHY is very damaging both psychologically and emotionally.  Testing will bring understanding
attributes.additional_details: Testing is not routinely offered unless a lady has had 3 or more miscarriages, or her loss happens in the second or third trimester.  As miscarriages happen in 1:4 pregnancies this leaves a very high percentage of women with questions and unimaginable pain.  The not knowing WHY is often the hardest to come to terms with.  Many miscarriages do have an underlying reason and for the parents who have lost their baby this is vital information that would help them.  They have the right to know WHY.

attributes.action: I propose a referendum to Ban the Burqa in public to be set into UK law
attributes.background: Due to governments once again not listening to the people who elect them I propose you hold a referendum to ban the burqa in all public spaces.  Let the people decide the fate / destiny of our country rather than politically correct politicians worried about being re-elected.
attributes.additional_details: https://yougov.co.uk/news/2016/08/31/majority-public-backs-burka-ban/

attributes.action: GOVT Ban all existing & proposed PSPOs affecting quality of life of dog owners
attributes.background: Borough councils are waging Total War against dog owners by abusing the Public Spaces Protection Order (PSPO). PSPOs are grossly abused by councils to impose wide restrictions against and affect the quality of life of a SINGLE demographic. HMGovt ban all orders preventing off lead exercising of dogs
attributes.additional_details: PSPOs are intended to prevent Criminal & Anti-Social behaviour, e.g. a PSPO can be used to gate a community to prevent persistent anti-social offences like burglary, violence, drinking & drugs. PSPOs are not intended to penalise, criminalise and demonise dog owners wishing to provide humane exercise to their dogs. Councils even raise PSPOs against Town and Village Greens (‘TVGs’) & Public Rights of Way affecting the quality of life for millions of people. HMG ban all such orders immediately

attributes.action: Fireworks - ONLY SOLD to the public with licence from Local Council @ £50.
attributes.background:
Sale of FIREWORKS - The way forward
a)  To purchase FIREWORKS public need to obtain a licence from their Local Council.  Licence should be at least £50, dates avail on a website.
b)  People need to use Facebook/media as a Communication tool to let others know about forthcoming firework displays.

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum standard of contraceptive availability across the UK
attributes.background: The Independent and BBC report that funding cuts have caused some GPs to stop providing the contraceptive coil, IUD and contraceptive implant. It makes no sense to reduce access to cost-effective, proven modern contraceptive innovations; local authorities must receive adequate funds to provide this.
attributes.additional_details: Access to a full range of contraception prevents pregnancy (abortions and raising unplanned children are both more costly) and is vital for managing many health problems (thyroid malfunction, severe migraine/period pain, endometriosis). Government must a) require ring-fenced, guaranteed contraceptive funding (and reinstate provisions where cut) b) enforce minimum provisions: amount of options discussed with patients and available within a certain distance, and availability of long-acting methods

attributes.action: Let private hire vehicles use bus lanes just like black cabs can
attributes.background: We as private hire drivers do the same job as bus drivers and black cab drivers so why ain't we allowed to use bus lanes

attributes.action: When failing qts tests, Remove the 2 Year ban after failing tests 3 times
attributes.background: When future trainee teachers fail there qts tests 3 times, there is a two year ban for re-sitting the tests. However when a person fails there theory test 3 times, they do not get a two year ban. I suggest the ban be removed. The tests should be re-sat unlimited times, until passed.
attributes.additional_details: The tests will still need to be passed therefore the same high standard is set.

attributes.action: Urge the Iranian Government to free Nazanin Ratcliffe
attributes.background:
Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe,  was visiting family in Iran. She was  returning to the UK in April when she was detained by the Iranian  Guard. Now she is in solitary confinement and has no  lawyer
Gabriella is her 22 month old daughter.
Her British husband, and Red Cross have had no contact.

attributes.action: Allow Retail Promotions of First Formula Milk once the UK leaves the EU.
attributes.background: EU law prohibits retailers from discounting new baby formula milk and from offering coupons or points with loyalty schemes. Whilst we know 'Breast is Best', what if a woman can't breastfeed or chooses not to? We should be able to choose how to feed our babies without justification or judgement.

attributes.action: Implement a statutory body to deal with animal welfare prosecutions
attributes.background: The animal welfare crisis is spiralling out of control the government are in denial,enforcement and prosecution is lacking on a large scale.Animals need a robust and enforced system.It must move on from private prosecution and the state should prosecute as it does in every other area of the law.

attributes.action: Change the name of the new GCSE's, as they are harder and worth more.
attributes.background: Recently GCSE's have been changed to make them more challenging for students. They have been made to prepare the students more for a levels, and we believe that this will be more challenging to get a good grade. The name 'GCSE' should be changed to something different.
attributes.additional_details:
Students now have to memorise there anthology (18 poems) in English.
Formulae have been removed from the Mathematics and Science GCSEs. So that must be memorised too.
Coursework has been replaced by full examinations. 
The content of the Mathematics GCSE has been expanded to cover A-Level topics.

attributes.action: Can the exploration of Shale gas be given priority in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Despite promises by the government to speed up the exploitation of Shale gas, it seems to be stalled. Could the government be more dynamic in their approach to ensure that the United Kingdom benefits from Shale, especially as Brexit approaches

attributes.action: Demand easy re-registration of British-registered vehicles in other EU countries
attributes.background: British citizens re-registering their vehicles abroad (in the EU) are experienced serious and costly administrative obstruction, or being refused. Vehicles presented in EU states with accompanying V5C that states the vehicle's EC Type Approval Number should be allowed easy and low-cost registration.
attributes.additional_details:
A core principle of the EU is freedom of movement of citizens and labour. Migrating citizens' vehicles should be easy to re-register in EU states if the registrant presents an EC Type Approval Number as printed on the UK V5C. This number proves EU-wide road conformity for the vehicle.

This is supported by  EC directive 2007/C68/04 which states that a vehicle already registered in a member state should not be tested again on the same criteria at re-registration or have to undergo further tests.

attributes.action: Stop passport checks on pregnant NHS patients
attributes.background: The proposals by St. George's University Hospital Trust, and backed by the Home Office, that pregnant people would be subject to mandatory passport checks before being able to access care to crack down on "health tourism" are deeply worrying, steeped in racism, and should be rejected immediately.
attributes.additional_details: Antenatal wards already require a form with proof of eligibility but these cannot always be done fully. The proposals would require checks to be stricter and could, in the view of multiple critics and medical staff, lead to higher risk to patient health. These proposals give no assurance that patients would have access to care regardless of immigration status, as is current government policy and law. Focus on "health tourism" is a racist smokescreen for the Conservatives' destruction of the NHS.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in the PM for failure to condemn US stance on refugees.
attributes.background: Theresa May has allied herself to President Trump bringing the UK into disrepute. We want a chance to show our displeasure by asking parliament for a vote of no confidence, triggering a general election

attributes.action: Public enquiry into DEFRA's handling of Bird Flu 2016/17
attributes.background: Defra have failed to provide timely, clear & consistent info to poultry keepers and the general public throughout the prevention zone and outbreak period.
attributes.additional_details: The law relating to lockdown requirements is vague.  Defra/Apha/Trading Standards representatives are issuing conflicting information when questions have been raised. The general public have received minimal information via the media, any information has been actively sought by those with online access and a passing knowledge of the situation. We (the public) have many questions that require clear answers.

attributes.action: Review the cases of each of the 3859 prisoners still held under IPP scheme
attributes.background: As of September, 3,859 prisoners were still in custody after being sentenced to an IPP and more than 8/10 were beyond the expiry date of the original sentence. IPP was scrapped in 2012. What they have served is disproportionate to the crimes they have committed.

attributes.action: Change Just in Case medication policy to Debbiebox a NHS Standard practice in GP
attributes.background: My mum spent 4 hour dying in pain due to MAR chart missing. Ambulance Crew couldn't give drugs needed. My mum died hospital 1hr pain free. I had to watch her. Just in Case box is NOT standard practice. We want a Debbiebox in place in every GP with MAR, DNS and drugs and comes direct from GP.
attributes.additional_details:
The MAR charts was not requested at my GP and was missed out.  District nurse request a JUST IN CASE BOX. This GP didn't have a box policy.

The Debbiebox is a palliative care box which will have telephone numbers, drugs, MAR chart and DNR form, syringes it will be done by a GP alone.

Currently each GP has their own policy it should be standard practice so no miscommunication happens resulting in mistakes and someone dying in pain. 
This would stop compensation claims and is cost effective.
